POST direct_messages/events/new.Description:
Publishes a new message_create event resulting in a Direct Message sent to a specified user from the authenticating user. Returns an event if successful. Supports publishing Direct Messages with optional Quick Reply and media attachment. Replaces behavior currently provided by POST direct_messages/new.
Requires a JSON POST body and Content-Type header to be set to application/json. Setting Content-Length may also be required if it is not automatically.

Parameters.Name: type
Parameters.Description: The type of event you are posting. For Direct Messages, use message_create.

Parameters.Name: message_create.target.recipient_id
Parameters.Description: The ID of the user who should receive the direct message.

Parameters.Name: message_create.message_data
Parameters.Description: The Message Data Object defining the content to deliver to the recipient.

Parameters.Name: text
Parameters.Description: The text of your Direct Message. URL encode as necessary. Max length of 10,000 characters. Max length of 9,990 characters if used as a Welcome Message.

Parameters.Name: quick_reply.type
Parameters.Description:
The Quick Reply type to present to the user (example requests below):
options - Array of Options objects (20 max).
text_input - Text Input object.
location - Location object.

Parameters.Name: attachment.type
Parameters.Description: The attachment type. Can be media or location.

Parameters.Name: attachment.media.id
Parameters.Description: A media id to associate with the message. A Direct Message may only reference a single media_id. See Uploading Media for further details on uploading media.
